III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) The facility is non-contracted, therefore, MISEP requirements are not applicable.
3.) The facility is not a local MDHHS office nor does the facility have a MDHHS
contract, therefore, MDHHS policy/MDHHS contract are not applicable.

The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The renewal inspection completed on 3/29/2021 with a corrective action plan
approved on 4/20/2021. During the review the agency had five violations. No
citations were noted as repeat violations in the current inspection. During this period
under review the agency stated there were no identified barriers to achieving overall
compliance.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported the agency did not have any identified barriers during this
review period. The Chief Administrator (CA) stated the previous year CAP was
effective and there are good systems in place. The CA expressed confidence the
agency will continue to utilize the processes identified in the previous year CAP to
maintain compliance.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff via telephone. Staff did not identify any
barriers or challenges during the past review period. Staff reported the weekly team
meetings are helpful in the event an issue arises, a coworker can assist and has
some knowledge of the case. Staff reported feeling supported by supervisors and
coworkers and did not report any areas of need.
4

Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
